item.title: Psychiatry
item.description: Only psychiatrists will ask you if you want to go from dose X to dose Y of some given drug. Who should be doing the asking? If years of medical school are doing the asking, something is wrong. Only psychiatrists will chastise you for giving the “wrong” response, because they weren’t asking you, they were giving you the illusion of free will by offering the opportunity to show alignment with their opinion.

item.title: On Parroting the Soundbites of Anti-Drug Propaganda
item.description: I believe that the drug enthusiast community is becoming increasingly better at striking a behavioral balance between normalizing sustainable and responsible drug-fueled hedonism and making the idea of harm reduction salient. Most of us have been exposed to biased, moralistic anti-drug propaganda. Some of us (rightfully so) aim to deconstruct such propaganda and invalidate it as a reductionist, uninformed viral idea about a specific drug (“GHB is a date-rape drug.") or a category of substances (“All opioids are morbidly addictive.
